question.title: Create a lambda function that is triggered by SQS
question.body:
I am writing a code using the library aws-serverless-java-container-springboot3 to be triggered by SQS messages. My application is using Spring Boot 3 because I have a few internal libraries that I want to import here and save time instead of write custom code.

All documentation from the library only shows how to use when your Lambda is behind an API Gateway, but I want to have it behind a SQS Queue.

Is it possible to have my Spring beans or is mandatory to create a controller and use a proxy handler?

Right now, I'm kinda stuck how to achieve it without the controller:

package aus.gov.mkt.function.handler;

import com.amazonaws.serverless.exceptions.ContainerInitializationException;
import com.amazonaws.serverless.proxy.model.AwsProxyRequest;
import com.amazonaws.serverless.proxy.model.AwsProxyResponse;
import com.amazonaws.serverless.proxy.spring.SpringBootLambdaContainerHandler;
import com.amazonaws.services.lambda.runtime.Context;
import com.amazonaws.services.lambda.runtime.RequestHandler;
import com.amazonaws.services.lambda.runtime.events.SQSEvent;

public class Handler implements RequestHandler<SQSEvent, Void> {

    private static final SpringBootLambdaContainerHandler<AwsProxyRequest, AwsProxyResponse> lambdaContainerHandler;

    static {
        try {
            lambdaContainerHandler = SpringBootLambdaContainerHandler.getAwsProxyHandler(Handler.class);
        } catch (ContainerInitializationException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
            throw new RuntimeException("ERROR", e);
        }
    }

    @Override
    public Void handleRequest(SQSEvent sqsEvent, Context context) {
        // is possible to get my bean here?
        return null;
    }
}

Is there any way to achieve it or do I need to create a controller?
